title: The Minister's Office
atmosphere: Formal but not unfriendly. Greener is direct and businesslike. His office is functional, decorated with fishing trophies and offworld certificates.
description: The Travellers meet Minister Alan Greener, who controls access to offworld ships. He explains the situation with the Highndry and offers terms for its release.
objectives: Understand what happened to the previous crew

triggers.entry: Travellers travel by rail from Startown to the capital after arranging meeting
triggers.exit: Survey deal struck OR Travellers refuse terms

key_dialogue.greener_opening: So you're here about the Highndry. I was wondering when someone would show up. The previous crew... didn't leave on the best terms.
key_dialogue.the_deal: I'll make you a fair offer. Cr3000 for a survey of Mount Salbarii's volcanic activity. Complete the survey, and the ship is yours to take.
key_dialogue.if_pushed: The government already paid the previous crew. They didn't deliver. I'm offering you a way to earn the ship - that's more than fair.

automatic: Previous crew took payment, did poor work, fled
Ship is disabled in crater of Mount Salbarii
persuade_check: Volcanic activity has been increasing lately
The Minister is under pressure from Masterton
There's been talk of evacuating Salbarii town

narrator_prompt: The Minister for Offworld Affairs, Public Relations, and Fisheries has a lot of titles for a small world. Alan Greener earned them by being competent and direct. He's not hostile - but he's not giving anything away either.
